questions.text: A child was brought with pedal edema and cheilosis. Further investigations revealed cardiomegaly. What is the vitamin deficiency associated with this clinical presentation?(NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Thiamine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Vitamin B1 deficiency disorders
  • ➤ Vitamin B1 deficiency disorders

questions.text: A 30-year-old patient presented with proximal weakness, lethargy, low/depressed mood, and recurrent renal stones. Laboratory testing revealed a normal S. Calcium and increased PTH levels. What is the organ involved and the pathology? (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Parathyroid gland and hyperparathyroidism

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Normocalcemic primary hyperparathyroidism presents with normal serum calcium and elevated PTH levels and is associated with symptoms like proximal weakness, lethargy, low mood, and recurrent renal stones. It is a diagnosis of exclusion after ruling out other causes of secondary hyperparathyroidism.

questions.text: Identify the structure passing through the foramen marked 2? ( AIIMS May 2017)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Abducens nerve

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: FAD status in body is determined by?(NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Glutathione reductase

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ FAD is the active form of Vitamin B 2 and marker for the B 2 deficiency is RBC glutathione reductase activity as this enzyme require B 2 as coenzyme. So, in case of FAD deficiency, glutathione reductase activity will be lowered without affecting the quantity of enzyme.

References:

  • ↳ Reference : Harper’s 31 st ed/pg- 534

questions.text: A patient recovered from hepatitis B infection. Which of the following curve represents antibodies seen 4 weeks post-recovery? (INICET MAY 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Anti HBs

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Anti-HBs antibodies indicate recovery and immunity from hepatitis B infection. This is the only protective antibody that signifies the patient has successfully recovered from the infection and has developed immunity.

questions.text: While working at a rural health sub-centre, you and a medical intern are analyzing annual infant registration metrics. The intern inquires about the expected annual infant registration rate when a health worker is actively on duty at the sub center. What is the best representation of this rate? (AIIMS MAY 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 150

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a rural health sub-centre, the expected annual infant registration rate effectively captures both the births and adjustments for infant mortality. The number 150 serves as a practical target for ensuring all newborns are accounted for within the community health system. This figure supports proactive health planning and resource allocation, emphasizing the importance of accurate and timely health data registration.
  • ➤ In a rural health sub-centre, the expected annual infant registration rate effectively captures both the births and adjustments for infant mortality.
  • ➤ The number 150 serves as a practical target for ensuring all newborns are accounted for within the community health system.
  • ➤ This figure supports proactive health planning and resource allocation, emphasizing the importance of accurate and timely health data registration.

questions.text: A young child presented with nocturnal chest pain and a history of syncope has the ECG shown below. What is the most probable diagnosis? ( INICET Nov 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Brugada syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Brugada syndrome should be suspected in patients, especially young males, with a history of syncope or nocturnal chest pain presenting with the characteristic ECG pattern of pseudo-right bundle branch block and ST-segment elevation in leads V1 and V2.

questions.text: The enzyme that is not used in cholesterol synthesis? ( INICET May 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) HMG CoA lyase

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective :
  • ➤ HMG CoA lyase is not used in the cholesterol synthesis pathway; it is involved in ketogenesis.

questions.text: Which of the following neurons predominantly fire during forceful expiration?(NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Ventral group of neurons

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Ventral Respiratory Group of neurons, particularly some subsets within this group, are actively involved in generating the neural signals required for forceful expiration, making them essential during increased respiratory demands such as during intense physical activity.

questions.text: A 65-year-old female patient weighing 60 kg is on mechanical ventilation for ARDS secondary to urosepsis. The respiratory parameters are as follows: tidal volume- 360 mL; frequency- 30 breaths/min; PEEP- 5 cm of H2O; and FiO2- 90%. The arterial blood gas findings are as follows: paO2- 50 mmHg; paCO2- 38 mmHg and pH- 7.38. What is the next step? ( INICET MAY 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Increase PEEP

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In ARDS management, if the patient remains hypoxemic despite a high FiO2, the next step is to increase the PEEP to improve oxygenation while maintaining lung-protective ventilation strategies.

questions.text: Identify the site which is responsible for relieving pain when pressure is applied to the painful area? ( AIIMS Nov 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Periaqueductal gray

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The periaqueductal gray (PAG) is a critical component of the analgesia system, responsible for relieving pain by sending inhibitory signals to block pain transmission in the spinal cord.

questions.text: Which of the following is true? ( INICET Nov 2022)

options.label: A
options.text: To break AT bonds high Tm is required

options.label: B
options.text: To break GC bonds low Tm is required

options.label: C
options.text: To break AT bonds low Tm is required

options.label: D
options.text: AT bonds and GC bonds need the same TM

questions.correct_answer: C. To break AT bonds low Tm is required
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) To break AT bonds low Tm is required

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ In DNA, there are two hydrogen bonds between A and T and three hydrogen bonds between G and C. So, AT bonds will require a lower Tm (melting temperature) compared to GC bonds as less energy is required for breaking 2 bonds compared to three bonds.

questions.text: Fine needle aspiration cytology (FNAC) is not sufficient to diagnose which of the following conditions? (AIIMS NOV 2016)
questions.correct_answer: B. Follicular carcinoma of the thyroid
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Follicular carcinoma of the thyroid

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ FNAC is not sufficient for diagnosing follicular carcinoma of the thyroid because it cannot detect capsular or vascular invasion, which is essential for differentiation from follicular adenoma.

questions.text: A 16-year-old male patient is diagnosed with osteosarcoma and is scheduled to undergo chemotherapy as part of his treatment. Methotrexate is included in his chemotherapy regimen. What is the mechanism of action of methotrexate in the treatment of his osteosarcoma? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Competitive inhibitor of DHFR.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Methotrexate's primary mechanism of action in treating osteosarcoma is as a competitive inhibitor of dihydrofolate reductase (DHFR), which interferes with DNA synthesis and cell division in rapidly dividing cells.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a major diagnostic criterion of neuromyelitis Optica? (INICET MAY 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Focal epilepsy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Diagnostic Criteria for Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (NMOSD)
  • ➤ Diagnostic Criteria for Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (NMOSD)
  • ➤ Most Common Core Clinical criteria:
  • ➤ Most Common Core Clinical criteria:
  • ➤ Longitudinal extensive transverse myelitis (acute myelitis) Optic neuritis, often bilateral Area postrema syndrome
  • ➤ Longitudinal extensive transverse myelitis (acute myelitis)
  • ➤ Optic neuritis, often bilateral
  • ➤ Area postrema syndrome
  • ➤ Less Common Clinical Criteria:
  • ➤ Less Common Clinical Criteria:
  • ➤ Acute brainstem syndrome Acute diencephalic syndrome, which can manifest as symptomatic narcolepsy Symptomatic cerebral syndrome (symptomatic cerebral lesions)
  • ➤ Acute brainstem syndrome
  • ➤ Acute diencephalic syndrome, which can manifest as symptomatic narcolepsy
  • ➤ Symptomatic cerebral syndrome (symptomatic cerebral lesions)
  • ➤ Some patients with NMOSD may have anti-NMO IgG antibody positivity, also known as anti-aquaporin 4 antibody (AQP4-IgG).

questions.text: Which of the following muscle is not supplied by the structure marked by red arrow? ( AIIMS May 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Superior oblique

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: A 60-year-old patient presented with scrotal swelling and ataxia. Which among the following could likely be a cause? (AIIMS NOV 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Non-Hodgkin lymphoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL), particularly Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma (DLBCL), is a likely cause of scrotal swelling and ataxia due to its potential for extranodal involvement and associated paraneoplastic syndromes.
  • ➤ Non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL), particularly Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma (DLBCL),

questions.text: Which of the following is related to the marked area in the image? ( AIIMS Nov 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Stomach

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The stomach is located anterior to the right kidney. The part of the stomach that lies in close proximity to the right kidney is the lesser curvature, specifically the anterior aspect of the stomach. The right kidney is situated posterior to this portion of the stomach.

questions.text: The given life cycle belongs to which of the following organisms? (INICET NOV 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Leptospira

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The life cycle of Leptospira involves transmission from animal reservoirs through contaminated water and soil, leading to human infection, which fits the depiction in the provided images.

questions.text: The slowing of conduction in multiple sclerosis is due to which of the following? (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Loss of myelin sheath

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Multiple sclerosis is characterized by demyelination that results in loss of saltatory conduction occurring from one node of Ranvier to the other .
  • ➤ demyelination that results in loss of saltatory conduction occurring from one node of Ranvier to the other

References:

  • ↳ Reference - Harrison/Multiple sclerosis/Chap 444

questions.text: A 60-year-old patient presents to the clinic for routine evaluation. During the consultation, the physician discusses various regulatory systems in the body that maintain homeostasis through negative feedback mechanisms. One system is particularly efficient in regulating blood volume by adjusting urine output based on hormonal influences. The physician explains that this system can theoretically achieve a feedback gain approaching infinity, maintaining blood volume within a narrow range. Which of the following systems exhibits a feedback gain of infinity in a negative feedback mechanism?

options.label: A
options.text: Blood volume regulation by the kidney

questions.explanation:
Ans. D) None of the above

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Negative feedback mechanisms are critical for maintaining physiological stability, but none achieve true infinite feedback gain. The kidneys' role in blood volume regulation is highly efficient and can theoretically approach infinite gain; however, in reality, biological systems maintain balance within limits to avoid instability.

questions.text: A 14-year-old boy presented to the OPD with a scald injury on his arm. The lesion was pink, oozing, and painful to moving air and touch. Which of the following would be the most appropriate management? (AIIMS NOV 2017)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Collagen dressing

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The best dressing for burn wounds is skin; collagen is a good substitute for skin, especially in partial-thickness burns. For full-thickness burns, sequential excision and grafting must be considered.
  • ➤ Initial treatment for burns includes cleaning the burnt areas and removing loose dead skin. Blisters are de-roofed and an appropriate dressing is applied.
  • ➤ Biological dressing (collagen dressings, amniotic membrane, etc.) is the preferred dressing material, especially in partial thickness burns.
  • ➤ If this is not available then a non-adhesive dressing like paraffin gauze impregnated with silver sulfadiazine (SSD) cream, colloidal silver, ionic silver cream, or silver nitrate cream may be applied. Since increased resistance to SSD has recently emerged, it should be used judiciously and reserved for deep dermal, full thickness, infected, and old neglected burns.

questions.text: A patient presented with a high fever, altered sensorium, headache, neck rigidity, and seizures. He was diagnosed with HSV encephalitis. Which of the following tests can be used to confirm the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2023)

options.label: D
options.text: CSF culture on chick embryo lines

questions.correct_answer: C. CSF PCR for viral DNA
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) CSF PCR for viral DNA

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For a rapid and accurate diagnosis of HSV encephalitis, CSF PCR for viral DNA is the gold standard, essential for guiding appropriate antiviral therapy.

questions.text: All of the following are criteria for diagnosis of DKA except: (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) S. Potassium < 3.5 mEq/L

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The diagnostic criteria for DKA include hyperglycemia, ketosis, and metabolic acidosis with an increased anion gap. Potassium levels, while important to monitor and manage in DKA, are not part of the diagnostic criteria.

questions.text: On thyroid function test analysis, TSH value was much higher than normal with low free T4. What is the diagnosis? (AIIMS MAY 2017)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Primary hypothyroidism

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The primary hypothyroidism is characterized by high TSH and low free T4 levels, indicating a failure of the thyroid gland itself to produce sufficient hormones.

questions.text: In an urban area in the state of Madhya Pradesh, a first-time pregnant woman visits a healthcare facility for her delivery following encouragement from an ASHA worker. What monetary advantages will they obtain under the Janani Suraksha Yojana? (NEET PG 2022)
questions.correct_answer: A. 1000 for mother and 400 for ASHA
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 1000 for mother and 400 for ASHA

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ (LPS: Low performing states; HPS: High performing states)
  • ➤ (LPS include UP, Uttarakhand, MP, Jharkhand, Bihar, Chhattisgarh, Odisha, Assam, Jammu & Kashmir, Rajasthan)

questions.text: Among the given statements, which one would lead you to consider primary amenorrhea as a possibility? (INICET MAY 2023) Failure to attain menarche by 15 years of age Failure to attain menarche even after 3 years of thelarche High levels of TSH and short stature Failure of development of breasts by 13 years of age
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 1, 2, 4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Primary amenorrhea should be considered if there is failure to attain menarche by 15 years of age, failure to attain menarche even after 3 years of thelarche, or failure of breast development by 13 years of age.

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman presents to the gynecology clinic with complaints of light menstrual periods and difficulty conceiving. She reports a history of a dilation and curettage (D&C) procedure performed six months ago following a miscarriage. Since then, her periods have become significantly lighter, and she has been unable to conceive despite regular attempts. A hysterosalpingography (HSG) is performed, revealing intrauterine filling defects. Based on these findings, what is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Asherman syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Asherman syndrome is characterized by the formation of intrauterine adhesions, typically following trauma to the endometrium from procedures like dilation and curettage (D&C). It presents with symptoms such as hypomenorrhea, secondary amenorrhea, and infertility. Diagnosis is confirmed through hysterosalpingography or hysteroscopy, and treatment involves hysteroscopic adhesiolysis followed by measures to prevent recurrence.

questions.text: Which of the following changes can be seen in the quadruple screening for Down syndrome? (INICET MAY 2018)

options.label: A
options.text: Elevated B-hCG, PAPP-A and lower estriol, AFP

options.label: B
options.text: Elevated B-hCG, Inhibin and lower estriol, AFP

options.label: C
options.text: Lower -CG, PAPP-A and elevated estriol, AFP

options.label: D
options.text: Lower B-hCG, Inhibin and elevated estriol, AFP

questions.correct_answer: B. Elevated B-hCG, Inhibin and lower estriol, AFP
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Elevated B-hCG, Inhibin and lower estriol, AFP

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In Down syndrome (Trisomy 21), the quadruple test shows elevated β hCG and Inhibin A, and decreased AFP and uE3.
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 863, Williams Obstetrics 26 th edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 863, Williams Obstetrics 26 th edition

questions.text: A 40-year-old male presents with increased thirst and increased frequency and volume of urination. He has no other symptoms. His random blood sugar was 205 mg/dl, what appropriate investigations should be done? ( INICET Nov 2023) HbA1c Urine ACR Echocardiography Fundoscopy ECG Serum protein electrophoresis
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) i, ii, iv, v

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For a newly diagnosed diabetic patient, essential investigations include HbA1c, urine ACR, fundoscopy, and ECG to assess glycemic control, kidney function, eye health, and cardiovascular risk, respectively.

questions.text: Premature ejaculation is a disorder of which phase of the normal sexual cycle? (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Orgasm

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Premature ejaculation is a disorder of the orgasm phase of the sexual response cycle. It is characterized by a pattern of persistent or recurrent ejaculation with minimal sexual stimulation before or immediately after the vaginal penetration.

References:

  • ↳ Reference: Kaplan & Sadock’s Synopsis of Psychiatry, 11th edition, Page No 579.

questions.text: Which of the following tests relies on the principle that prior knowledge of events or activities will influence a suspect's physiological responses? (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. Brain Mapping

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Brain mapping detects recognition of familiar stimuli through brain wave responses, reflecting a suspect's prior knowledge of events or activities

questions.text: Identify the cranial nerve that arises from the marked part? ( INICET May 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. Abducens nerve

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The abducens nerve, also known as cranial nerve VI, arises from the abducens nucleus in the pontomedullary junction, which is located in the lower part of the pons and upper part of the medulla oblongata in the brainstem. It exits the brainstem at the junction of the pons and medulla oblongata and travels through the cavernous sinus to innervate the lateral rectus muscle of the eye. Its main function is to control eye movement and allow for horizontal gaze.

questions.text: Identify the lesion in the histopathological image of retina: ( AIIMS Nov 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Drusen are distinct, granular deposits at the interface between the retinal pigment epithelium and Bruch's membrane, commonly associated with age-related macular degeneration and can be an early sign of the disease.

questions.text: A 42-year-old man presents to the dermatology clinic with a six-month history of progressive skin changes. He reports multiple patches on his skin as shown below. The lesions are painless but feel different from normal skin, and he has noticed reduced sensation in some areas. The patient also describes occasional muscle weakness in his hands. On examination, he has multiple, irregularly shaped plaques on his trunk with varying levels of pigmentation. Neurological examination reveals patchy sensory loss over the lesions. A skin biopsy shows granulomatous inflammation with the presence of acid-fast bacilli. Based on the clinical findings and the image shown below, which type of leprosy is most likely causing these clinical manifestations?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Borderline (Dimorphous) leprosy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Borderline leprosy presents with asymmetrical lesions that can appear as plaques with unique morphological features such as central depression. This type of leprosy is immunologically unstable and prone to shifts, requiring accurate diagnosis and timely treatment to prevent progression and complications.

questions.text: Superior gluteal nerve supplies all of the following structures except: (INICET NOV 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. Piriformis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The piriformis muscle is not supplied by the superior gluteal nerve. Instead, it is primarily innervated by the branches of the sacral plexus, specifically the ventral rami of S1 and S2. The piriformis muscle plays a role in external hip rotation.

questions.text: Name the parasite whose microfilaria have a sheath with no nuclei at the tail end. (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Wuchereria bancrofti

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Microfilariae of Wuchereria bancrofti are identified by their sheathed structure and the absence of nuclei at the tail end, crucial for the specific diagnosis of lymphatic filariasis caused by this parasite. This detail is significant for medical students and professionals working in endemic areas to recognize and diagnose the infection accurately.

questions.text: Which of the provided options align with the depicted equivalence margin graph? (INICET MAY 2021) ‘A’ represents superiority of new treatment ‘I’ represents Inferiority of new treatment ‘E’ represents Non-inferior treatment ‘C’ is inconclusive
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 1, 2 and 3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In equivalence margin graphs for RCTs, 'A' can indicate a superior treatment, 'I' an inferior treatment, and 'E' a non-inferior treatment. 'C' does not represent an inconclusive result; it represents superiority.
  • ➤ In equivalence margin graphs for RCTs, 'A' can indicate a superior treatment, 'I' an inferior treatment, and 'E' a non-inferior treatment. 'C' does not represent an inconclusive result; it represents superiority.

questions.text: A patient presented with abdominal pain and sterile pyuria, and the x-ray showed the following features. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Putty kidney

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Putty kidney is an advanced renal pathology often resulting from chronic infections such as tuberculosis, leading to extensive calcification and renal dysfunction. This condition is distinguishable on imaging by its irregular, extensive calcifications throughout the kidney, associated with clinical symptoms like abdominal pain and sterile pyuria.

questions.text: Match the following eggs to the organism? (INICET NOV 2021)
questions.explanation: Ans. D) 1-C, 2-D, 3-B, 4-A

questions.text: Identify the imaging modality given below. (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. PET CT

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A PET CT scan is crucial for the integrated assessment of anatomical and metabolic information, particularly useful in oncology for identifying and tracking the behavior of tumors based on their glucose metabolism, as visualized through radiotracer uptake.

questions.text: A farmer presents with a swollen foot and multiple sinuses as shown in the image below. What is the most likely diagnosis? (INICET NOV 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Mycetoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Mycetoma is characterized by swelling, draining sinuses, and colonial grains in exudates, and is common among individuals who walk barefoot. The diagnosis is supported by clinical presentation, histology, and the color of the grains. Treatment involves surgical debridement and prolonged antibiotic therapy for actinomycetoma or antifungal therapy for eumycetoma.

questions.text: Which vitamin, when infused in supraphysiological doses, causes macular edema and macular cysts? (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Vitamin B3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Nicotinic acid when given orally or parenterally produces a transient vasodilatation of the cutaneous vessels and histamine release. The reaction is accompanied by itching, burning and tingling . Intake of nicotinic acid in excess of 50 mg/day may lead to liver damage (Raised AST and ALT levels, Fulminant hepatitis)
  • ➤ histamine release.
  • ➤ itching, burning
  • ➤ and tingling
  • ➤ Niacin causes a reversible toxic cystoid maculopathy that occurs in approximately 0.67% of patients taking high doses of the drug.
  • ➤ reversible toxic cystoid maculopathy
  • ➤ Other symptoms –
  • ➤ Other symptoms –
  • ➤ Nausea, vomiting, and abdominal pain. Glucose intolerance (therefore weekly glucose monitoring done if given in diabetics) Hyperuricemia
  • ➤ Nausea, vomiting, and abdominal pain.
  • ➤ Glucose intolerance (therefore weekly glucose monitoring done if given in diabetics)
  • ➤ Glucose intolerance
  • ➤ Hyperuricemia
  • ➤ Hyperuricemia

questions.text: A 52-year-old male with a history of psychiatric disorders, is being treated with multiple medications. During a routine clinic visit, his psychiatrist reviews his treatment plan, including the use of risperidone. Off-label prescribing is a common practice, but it is important to distinguish approved uses from off-label ones. Which of the following is not an off-label use of risperidone?

options.label: C
options.text: Control of symptoms in post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)

questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Treatment of bipolar disorder

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Risperidone is approved for the treatment of bipolar disorder, making it a labeled use. Its application in other conditions, such as OCD, dementia-related agitation, and PTSD, represents off-label use, highlighting the importance of distinguishing between FDA-approved and non-approved indications in clinical practice.

questions.text: A patient presented to OPD with abdominal pain, jaundice, and portal hypertension. With the above symptoms identify the anastomosis seen in between veins: (NEET PG 2023)

options.label: A
options.text: Esophageal veins and left gastric veins

options.label: B
options.text: Left colic vein and middle colic veins

questions.correct_answer: A. Esophageal veins and left gastric veins
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Esophageal veins and left gastric veins

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: Structures passing between marked point ? (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Stylopharyngeus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The stylopharyngeus muscle passes between the superior and middle pharyngeal constrictors, and it is innervated by the glossopharyngeal nerve (cranial nerve IX).

questions.text: What is the proper disposal method for a damaged vaccine vial according to biomedical waste management protocols? (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Puncture proof blue bin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: Which of the following are seen in iron deficiency anemia? (INICET MAY 2023) 1.Reduced serum iron level 2.Reduced transferrin saturation 3.Increased total iron binding capacity 4.Reduced ferritin level
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 1, 2, 3, 4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Iron deficiency anemia involves reduced serum iron, reduced transferrin saturation, increased TIBC, and reduced ferritin levels

questions.text: The risk of genetic diseases in consanguineous marriage between first cousins is? (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 4-8%

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The risk of genetic diseases in consanguineous marriage between first cousins is estimated to be around 4-8%, which is higher than the general population risk of approximately 2-4%.

questions.text: A forest worker developed skin lesions over the forearm, which initially started as macules but then became nodules. Histology of the nodules shows the following findings. Which of the following is true regarding this condition? (INICET MAY 2022)

options.label: A
options.text: The organism does not invade underlying fascia, tendon, muscle, or joints.

options.label: B
options.text: Angioinvasion is common, especially in people with hemolytic anemia.

options.label: C
options.text: It is a dimorphic organism, and yeast forms are seen in clinical sample.

options.label: D
options.text: These bodies are formed by engulfment of the dead fungi by the macrophages.

questions.correct_answer: A. The organism does not invade underlying fascia, tendon, muscle, or joints.
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) The organism does not invade underlying fascia, tendon, muscle, or joints.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Chromoblastomycosis is characterized by skin lesions containing sclerotic bodies (Medlar bodies) and does not typically invade deeper tissues such as fascia, tendons, muscles, or joints.

questions.text: A 45-year-old male with a history of epilepsy has been successfully managed on carbamazepine for several years. Recently, his neurologist considered switching him to oxcarbazepine due to some side effects associated with carbamazepine. The physician discusses the differences in side effect profiles between the two medications, emphasizing that while both drugs share similar adverse effects, certain side effects are more commonly associated with one drug over the other. Which of the following side effects is more commonly seen with oxcarbazepine compared to carbamazepine?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Hyponatremia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hyponatremia is a notable adverse effect more commonly associated with oxcarbazepine than carbamazepine due to its impact on antidiuretic hormone activity. This distinction is crucial when considering the side effect profiles of these antiepileptic drugs.

questions.text: Oculocephalic reflex assesses the integrity of which of the following cranial nerves? (INICET NOV 2022) 1. III 2. IV 3. VI 4. VIII 5. VII
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) 1, 3 and 4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The oculocephalic reflex assesses the integrity of cranial nerves III (oculomotor), VI (abducens), and VIII (vestibulocochlear), which are crucial for coordinated eye movements in response to head motion.

questions.text: What is the most probable diagnosis for a child who has asymptomatic lesions on the forearm and shaft of the penis, lesions on the shaft of penis are as shown below? ( INICET May 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Lichen nitidus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Lichen nitidus is a probable diagnosis in a child with asymptomatic lesions on the forearm and genitalia , especially when the lesions appear as tiny, flesh-colored bumps.
  • ➤ Lichen nitidus
  • ➤ child
  • ➤ asymptomatic lesions
  • ➤ forearm and genitalia
  • ➤ tiny, flesh-colored
  • ➤ Ref - Rooks textbook of dermatology- 9 th Edition Chapter 37 page no 37.3, 37.10, 37.11, 37.39
  • ➤ Ref - Rooks textbook of dermatology- 9 th Edition Chapter 37 page no 37.3, 37.10, 37.11, 37.39
  • ➤ Fitzpatrick’s dermatology 9 th edition Page no 554
  • ➤ Fitzpatrick’s dermatology 9 th edition Page no 554

questions.text: Which of the following is not a long-acting reversible contraceptive method? (INICET MAY 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Laparoscopic tubal ligation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Laparoscopic tubal ligation is a permanent method of contraception and is not a long-acting reversible contraceptive (LARC).

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman comes with complaints of warty lesions on the vulva. On examination, multiple warty growths on the vulva and around the anal canal are seen. This condition is most likely seen in? (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Condyloma accuminata

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Condyloma acuminata (genital warts) are characterized by multiple warty growths on the vulva and around the anal canal, caused by HPV-6 and 11, and treated with cryotherapy, electrocautery, laser therapy, surgical excision, or topical agents.
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 153, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology 6 th edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 153, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology 6 th edition

questions.text: Which of the following is an absolute contraindication to OCP use? (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Thromboembolism

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Thromboembolism is an absolute contraindication to the use of combined oral contraceptives (COCs) due to the increased risk of venous thromboembolism associated with these medications.

questions.text: Identify the liver segment star marked in the image below: (INICET May 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. V

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: A surgically resected specimen of an ovarian mass is shown below. What is the likely diagnosis? (INICET NOV 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Mature cystic teratoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Mature cystic teratomas (dermoid cysts) are characterized by the presence of multiple tissue types such as hair, sebaceous material, and sometimes teeth or bone within a cystic ovarian mass.
  • ➤ Ref: William’s textbook of gynecology 3 rd edition pg, Dutta’s textbook of gynecology 6 th edition pg
  • ➤ Ref: William’s textbook of gynecology 3 rd edition pg, Dutta’s textbook of gynecology 6 th edition pg

questions.text: An acute encephalitis outbreak has occurred within the community, prompting the initiation of a vaccination campaign. Which of the following is true about the vaccine given in this condition? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The question is referring to Japanese Encephalitis (JE) outbreaks, which are not uncommon in India and parts of Southeast Asia. During such outbreaks, emergency vaccination campaigns are often undertaken to control the spread of disease.
  • • The most commonly used vaccine in these public health campaigns in India earlier used to be Live JE SA 14-14-2 vaccine (subcutaneous). But nowadays, the inactivated (killed) Vero cell–derived JE vaccine - JENVAC is used intramuscularly.
  • • Hence, the correct response based on updated national guidelines is:
  • • Killed and intramuscular.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option B) Live and subcutaneous:
  • • Option B) Live and subcutaneous:
  • • While the SA 14-14-2 vaccine is a live, attenuated vaccine given subcutaneously, recent protocols for outbreak settings increasingly prefer killed vaccines like JENVAC, especially in adult populations and for mass campaigns due to ease of storage and safety. Live vaccine SA -14-14-2 is quite good during outbreaks too. But JENVAC has an edge over SA 14-14-2 because of the higher immunity levels it creates with a single dose. Hence, although previously correct, SA 14-14-2 is no longer the preferred or updated answer.
  • • Option C) Live and intramuscular:
  • • Option C) Live and intramuscular:
  • • Live vaccines (like SA 14-14-2) are given subcutaneously. IM route is not used for Live JE SA 14-14-2 routinely.
  • • Option D) Killed and subcutaneous:
  • • Option D) Killed and subcutaneous:
  • • Killed JE vaccines (like JENVAC or IXIARO) are administered intramuscularly.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In the setting of a Japanese Encephalitis outbreak, the vaccine currently recommended and used in mass immunization campaigns in India is a killed (inactivated) vaccine administered via the intramuscular route, such as JENVAC. While older guidelines or some regions may have used the live attenuated SA 14-14-2 vaccine given subcutaneously, updated practices now favor the inactivated IM vaccine due to its broader safety profile and compatibility with adult vaccination. Always refer to the most recent national immunization guidelines when answering such public health–related MCQs.
